solution_line_template: Simplifying the equation, we get 2x = x+{mike_extra_cost}.
Subtracting x from each side of the equation, we are left with x={taco_grande_cost} dollars as the cost of the Taco Grande Plate.

Thus the combined total cost of Mike and John's lunch is {taco_grande_cost}+{taco_grande_cost}+{mike_salad_cost}+{mike_fries_cost}+{mike_cola_cost}=<<{taco_grande_cost}+{taco_grande_cost}+{mike_salad_cost}+{mike_fries_cost}+{mike_cola_cost}={combined_total_cost}>>{combined_total_cost} dollars.
